channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: This Week in Explainers: Why India’s ‘Poorvi Prachand Prahar’ military drill in Arunachal matters
History Today: How a German scientist accidentally discovered X-rays and changed the world
Authorities are trying to crack down on scammers in Southeast Asia. Here’s why it’s not working
Did Congress drop stanzas from ‘Vande Mataram’?
China launches Fujian: What do we know about first domestically-made aircraft carrier?
Are Donald Trump's claims of boat crews being narco-terrorists true?
Creating a new ‘Mamdania’: Without their narrative, Hindu Americans have no future
item.description: South Asianists have a cultural monopoly now over Indian children in America, and Hindu Americans have failed to invest where investment is needed – education in social sciences, arts, media, culture, and so on

item.title: How Zohran Mamdani struck a chord with New Yorkers
item.description: Mamdani’s ability to translate youth enthusiasm into structured organisation set him apart

item.title: What Zohran Mamdani’s win as New York mayor means for Hindu Americans
item.description: Sceptics of the promised Mamdani utopia have pointed out that his idealistic rainbow coalition is actually a triumph of foreign influence groups, Pakistani in particular—an ideological ‘Red-Green’ alliance that often considers India, Israel and America as oppressors and enemies

item.title: How Trishul exercise marks India’s shift from ‘Cold Start’ to ‘Cold Strike’ doctrine
item.description: For the broader strategic community, the message from Trishul is unambiguous. India has entered the phase of technological deterrence, where strength is measured not only by numbers or firepower but by integration, speed and autonomy

item.title: How America’s revival of nuclear testing could open Pandora’s box
item.description: Trump must recognise that nuclear weapons alone cannot sustain America’s image of strength and global leadership

item.title: Peace in South Caucasus will strengthen India-Armenia inter-regional cooperation
item.description: Even though India currently does not have a dedicated South Caucasus policy, and certain serious issues with Azerbaijan and Turkey hamper closer engagement, efforts must be made to iron out differences through dialogue and diplomacy
